item.description:
We will extend our detour from early American Pragmatism to follow up on a series of related ideas and writers that were under-represented in our long range plan. We will finish our exploration of Henri Bergson's James-inspired Creative Evolution. This will be followed by philosophers that were inspired by and expanded upon of some of Bergson's ideas including Jacques Lacan, Slavoj Zizek and  Giles Deleuze.

We will read the final two chapters of Creative Evolution, chapters 3 & 4. The text is available online at http://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/26163.

For those of you who were unable to read the first two chapters, don't have time to finish the book or are interested in reading more Bergson, his Introduction to Metaphysics (1903) is a short, consise and easy to follow overview of some of the ideas we will continue to explore of the next several meetings. Introduction to Metaphysics is available in several formats:

Portable Document Format:
http://www.realfuture.org/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/Introduction-to-Metaphysics.pdf   
American Library EBook:
http://archive.org/details/anintroductiont00berggoog
LibriVox Free Audiobook:
http://archive.org/details/introduction_to_metaphysics_0909_librivox
